Articles.Content:
Can anybody recommend some good mods with decent containers in them? I want some slick resource containers for use with TAC Life Support.

I've pruned out the KAS containers because they use two parts (and building while in space is a bit too OCD for me), although I might come back to them eventually and remove the PartModule, add resources, make them surface attachable so I don't need that damn frame, and put some stripes on them for differentiation. I'm also waiting on the KASPAR racks, but development seems a bit slow there.

Right now I'm re-purposing Nertea's Future Propulsion tanks to my needs; they've got a handy stripe that can easily be re-colored.

Any others?
If your looking for something large theres the old Kerb(o)Corp shipping containers on on spaceport, they're not updated but they are public domain. Very large but the design should scale well
Jesus, SpacePort is terrible... I can't open in a new tab? Those containers are pretty funny, I might have to check that out.

There's the WIP KASPAR, which should be seeing release in the form of FuzTek integration with the upcoming FuzTek R0.04 release (may be a while still). They work using the KAS plugin, are surface attachable, and have inline bays included allowing for full FAR support.

There's the WIP KASPAR, which should be seeing release in the form of FuzTek integration with the upcoming FuzTek R0.04 release (may be a while still). They work using the KAS plugin, are surface attachable, and have inline bays included allowing for full FAR support.

Does anyone ever bother reading OPs around here?

Well, I'm not sure is this decent, but if you ok with how KAS containers looks but don't need KAS functionality maybe try original model wich was splitted later for KAS by request.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43840-Hab-Hub-%28and-other-strange-things%29

It have five colors per texture but not very easy to edit.

Edited October 23, 2013 by zzz

How could I miss those, I was looking through your thread the other day... Thanks, because I really liked those.
